abstract: Mound of ice and debris still stands in Seaport district of Boston from city's record winter snowfall; officials say little rain, and trash hardened into the icy mix, has helped prevent snow from melting; last remains of 11 'snow farms' that were created for snow disposal, mound was at its peak 75 feet high, covering four acres.
lead_paragraph: A mound of ice and debris still stands in the Seaport district, where plows pushed relentlessly falling snow. No one is quite sure when it will melt.

headline.main: Remnant of Boston’s Brutal Winter Threatens to Outlast Summer
headline.print_headline: Remnant of Boston’s Winter Threatens to Outlast Summer

snippet: A mound of ice and debris still stands in the Seaport district, where plows pushed relentlessly falling snow. No one is quite sure when it will melt.
